data.meta_description:
Andrew in his full awesomeness! 

Living by his principles and open sourcing this very timely and relevant course!!
data.text:
I've had a realization about my own learning journey that I believe could resonate with many of you. For the longest time, I struggled with mathematics, finding it significantly more challenging than physics, even though both fields are closely related. But why was this the case? Recently, I stumbled upon a crucial insight â€“ the subjects I feel comfortable in are the ones I can visualize and bring to life in my mind's eye. The ability to imagine and mentally picture concepts has always been my key to feeling comfortable and confident in my studies. Lately, I've been participating in discussions on Coders High, where I've connected with individuals who share their insights and experiences. It was during these conversations that I realized the core reason why math felt elusive to me â€“ I could never quite picture its concepts in the same way I could with physics. This realization has not only given me a deeper understanding of my own learning style. Let's celebrate our unique ways of learning and discovering new methods to make tough subjects more understandable.

Iâ€™ll do a separate post discussing specific tools addressing these challengesâ€¦ âš–ï¸ ğğšğ¥ğšğ§ğœğ¢ğ§ğ  ğğ¢ğŸğŸğğ«ğğ§ğ­ ğ¬ğ¤ğ¢ğ¥ğ¥ ğ¥ğğ¯ğğ¥ğ¬ ğ¢ğ¬ ğ¯ğğ«ğ² ğğ¢ğŸğŸğ¢ğœğ®ğ¥ğ­ I heard this in all my education classes. But this time I felt it. We had a class filled with both professors and undergraduate students and it was simply impossible to cater to all of their needs and skill sets. What we found most helpful is to do a pre-assessment of student skills and frequent check-ins during class about their level of understanding. More soonâ€¦

ğŸ“ Exciting First Semester Update! ğŸš€ Hello, LinkedIn community! ğŸ‘‹ I just wrapped up an exhilarating first semester in my Bachelor of Engineering program with a focus on Artificial Intelligence! ğŸ“ Reflecting on this incredible journey, here's a quick dive into the exciting subjects and experiences that shaped my learningğŸ”: 1ï¸âƒ£ Explored the depths of Calculus and Linear Algebra, unravelling the beauty of computational mathematicsâ€”the foundation of AI. ğŸ§® 2ï¸âƒ£ Embraced the magic of Python Programming, a game-changer in the tech world, breathing life into AI applications and sparking a thrilling programming journey! ğŸ 3ï¸âƒ£ Delved into Content Management Systems (HTML, CSS, JavaScript), crafting immersive web experiencesâ€”from structural foundations to dynamic forces. ğŸ’» 4ï¸âƒ£ Engaged with the heart of the program, Artificial Intelligence, unraveling its historical roots, advancements, and limitless innovation potential. ğŸ¤– 5ï¸âƒ£ Explored Human Values and Professional Ethics, delving into the ethical ramifications of technology and emphasizing responsible AI development. ğŸŒ 6ï¸âƒ£ Applied theoretical knowledge in Project-Based Learning, collaborating on a GUI-based Billing System (with Keshav Julka) - bringing theory into real-world challenges. ğŸ’¡ Huge gratitude to Professors Ashwani Patiyal, Pankaj Chaudhary, Rakhi Nagpal, Sunil Chawla, Manu Midha, and Pooja Mahajan for guiding lights on this academic adventure! ğŸŒŸ Special thanks to the Dean, Dr. Sushil Narang and Course Coordinator, Dr. Kamaldeep Garg, for shaping a transformative learning experience. ğŸ™ğŸ“ As Class Representative, hosted Adjunct Professor Imran Medi from Asia Pacific University of Technology and Innovation during the 13th Global Week, adding unique insights to our learning journey. Also, I participated in a Research Presentation competition on the eve of Engineer's Day, further fueling my passion for exploration and discovery. ğŸŒğŸ‘©ğŸ’» Reflecting on personal and academic growth, I am excited to delve deeper into the world of AI with a strong ethical foundation. Cheers to conquering challenges, late-night coding sessions, and forming lasting friendships! ğŸŒŒ Looking forward to what the next semesters have in store - let's keep the momentum going! ğŸ’ª #AI #EngineeringJourney #FirstSemester #ContinuousLearning #chitkarauniversity

I just completed my first semester in the Artificial Intelligence masters program at University of Texas Austin. I decided to start off with "Ethics in AI", which was a great class to just get back into the swing of things after many years out of the classroom. If you are like me and starting to think about diving into world of Artificial Intelligence, well consider this a huge endorsement for this program. If you find yourself with full-time job, full time parenting and everything else...this masters is actually doable. Granted, I only took one class this semester and it will take 3 1/3 years to complete my degree if I only take one course each semester (including summer). The application process for next Spring (classes start January 2025) opens on June 1st. Quick Datapoints... * The classes are super flexible. There are video lectures that you watch when you have time. Homework however, has deadlines you need to turn them in by. The reading is manageable. * You go at your pace, meaning you can take as few or many classes as you want each semester. * The program is offered at $1,000 per class. That's $10,000 for a master's degree at a top 10 Computer Science program. * If you get stuck or have questions, there are TA's assigned to you that have office hours and are super responsive in the chat forums. Your classmates are also super friendly and helpful. * While the masters is online, there is nothing that differentiates it from a Masters that you would earn if you were on campus. This summer semester I am registered for Machine Learning and excited to get going. If anyone in my network is interested in learning more and wanting to chat, I will make time to talk to you and tell you my experience. Until then..."Hook em Horns!" https://lnkd.in/gz2e6G7n

Itâ€™s pretty clear to me that generative AI will profoundly shape higher education. I have had a blast brushing up my coding skills and learning new tricks while developing Pruju AI - with patient support and help from Enrico Glerean and Thomas Pfau from the Aalto Research Software Engineers team. Pruju AI acts as a helpful teaching assistant that is designed to answer any student question, but only if the answer can be found in the course materials (e.g., syllabus, slides, lecture transcripts). The assistant can also be guided to answer in ways that align with the courseâ€™s pedagogical objectives. Itâ€™s a no-brainer application, but a pretty useful at that. With GPT-4 in the background, I think itâ€™s really good actually. Check out a small demo below and stay tuned for more information! Aalto TUTA - Aalto University, Department of Industrial Engineering and Management

ğŸš€ Launch Your Data Science Journey: Free Summer Training Program for Computer Science Graduates! âŒ Tired of basic tutorials that don't deepen your understanding? âŒ Looking for practical, industry-level skills not covered in expensive courses? âŒ Need a program that fits into your busy schedule? We have the perfect opportunity for you: âœ… Limited to 20 motivated Computer Science graduates, ensuring personalized attention. âœ… Join us from June to August for two practical classes each week, including two group assignments. âœ… We'll dive into data analysis, classical machine learning, and give you a taste of computer vision and NLP. âœ…No costs involved, learn from the comfort of your home, as it is totally remote. âœ…Depending on group dynamics, tackle a real-world dummy projects to solidify your skills. Registration open until May 26! Don't miss out on turning theory into practice. Fill out the form now - link in the description below!

Earlier this semester, I had the privilege of being a guest lecturer for Prof. Gouri Gindeâ€™s SENG 471 - Software Requirements Engineering course at the University of Calgary. During the session, I discussed the transformative role of Applied AI in our recent use cases. This was a refreshing shift from the intensity of academic writing, where even the most novel ideas could contend with highly competitive review environments. Together, we explored how AI technologies, such as LLMs, can streamline tasks like completing natural language requirements, refining goal models, extracting requirements, and improving regulatory compliance. My goal was to bridge the gap between the research opportunities and challenges and their practical perspectives that can play a role in students' careers in software engineering. If this lecture has sparked curiosity or the ambition to further explore AI for software engineering for even a single student, then I consider it a triumph for myself. Here's to the next generation of software engineers, ready to explore AI and unlock new possibilities in ways we are just beginning to imagine! I want to also extend my thanks to my supervisors and co-authors for their invaluable support and collaboration throughout my academic journey.

ğŸ“ Excited to share that I've successfully completed the "Divide and Conquer, Sorting and Searching, and Randomized Algorithms " part of "Algorithms Specialization" course! ğŸ’» This comprehensive program delved deep into the world of algorithms, equipping me with a robust understanding of fundamental concepts and their practical applications in computer science. ğŸš€ Throughout this journey, I dedicated countless hours to mastering various algorithms, refining problem-solving skills, and gaining insights into efficient coding practices. ğŸŒ The knowledge gained is not just theoretical; it's a practical toolkit that I'm eager to apply in real-world scenarios. The course has not only broadened my perspective on algorithmic design but has also sharpened my ability to optimize solutions for complex challenges. ğŸ† Grateful for the opportunity to enhance my skills and grateful to Stanford University providing such a enriching learning experience. Excited to leverage this newfound expertise in my professional journey! to verify the certificate here is the link:https://lnkd.in/gpVAZS9y #Algorithms #ComputerScience #ContinuousLearning #AlgorithmDesign #ProblemSolving #AchievementUnlocked ğŸš€

ğŸ“ Thrilled to share that last year, I had the incredible opportunity to earn a professional certificate from No-code AI business solutions at MIT Professional Education In this transformative journey, I explored the theory and practical applications of supervised and unsupervised learning, neural networks, recommendation engines, and computer vision. ğŸ“š The emergence of no-code platforms has revolutionized how we approach data science and AI. These intuitive tools allow professionals from diverse sectors to efficiently classify information, conduct data analysis, and develop precise predictive models. ğŸš€ I dived into various no-code tools, including RapidMiner, Dataiku, KNIME, and Teachable Machine. These platforms enabled me to create innovative solutions without getting tangled in code. ğŸŒ ğŸ¤– As technology continues to evolve, understanding how to harness the power of AI is essential. This certificate program equipped me with the skills to create innovative solutions, streamline processes, and drive business growthâ€”all without writing a single line of code. ğŸ“ˆğŸ’¡ It wasn't always easy, but the learning journey was incredibly rewarding. This certificate represents my dedication to continuous learning and embracing innovation. What's next? I'm eager to apply my newfound expertise to solve real-world problems and explore the endless possibilities of no-code AI. https://lnkd.in/e-PYPshx

ğ…ğ«ğğ ğ¨ğ§ğ¥ğ¢ğ§ğ ğœğ¨ğ®ğ«ğ¬ğğ¬ ğŸğ«ğ¨ğ¦ ğ’ğ­ğšğ§ğŸğ¨ğ«ğ ğ”ğ§ğ¢ğ¯ğğ«ğ¬ğ¢ğ­ğ² ğˆğ§ğ¬ğ­ğ«ğ®ğœğ­ğ¨ğ«ğ¬! ğŸ“ Stanford University is setting a benchmark in educational accessibility by offering free online courses. No fees for the courses (with the exception of certificates), just pure knowledge! Whether you're a complete beginner or looking to expand your expertise, there's something for everyone. Hereâ€™s a sneak peek into the wealth of knowledge you can tap into: 1 - Computer Science 101: Dive into the basics of Computer Science, no prior experience required. https://lnkd.in/gGXraxfM 2- Intro to Artificial Intelligence: Uncover the fundamentals of AI and its applications. https://lnkd.in/gpT9REpM 3 - Artificial Intelligence for Robotics: Learn robotics programming from the experts behind Google and Stanford's autonomous driving teams. https://lnkd.in/gBgRVMQp 4 - Introduction to Python Programming: Grasp the Python language fundamentals and best practices in programming. https://lnkd.in/gxQd7T3t 5 - Introduction to Machine Learning: Explore the machine-learning process from data analysis to practical applications. https://lnkd.in/grFM7K3R 6 - Designing Your Career: Gain insights into launching a career in your field of interest, with new networking approaches. https://lnkd.in/g3Etvp9i 7 - Databases: Advanced Topics in SQL: Delve deeper into SQL with topics on indexes, transactions, and more. https://lnkd.in/gvJsaKYp 8 - Quantum Mechanics for Scientists and Engineers: Get a comprehensive introduction to quantum mechanics. https://lnkd.in/gCTxUdCj 9 - Principles of Economics: Learn the economic way of thinking and the principles of economics. https://lnkd.in/ghMCW7TK Education is the passport to the future, and Stanford is making it accessible for all. Which course will you dive into first? #stanford #education #innovation #ai #economics
